items.title: Axiom of Non-Deceptive Landscapes
items.content:
2131: :label: axiom-non-deceptive
2132: 
2133: The environment $(X_{\mathrm{valid}}, R_{\mathrm{pos}})$ is **non-deceptive** if there exist constants $\kappa_{\mathrm{grad}} > 0$ and $L_{\mathrm{grad}} > 0$ such that for any two points $x, y \in X_{\mathrm{valid}}$ with $\|x - y\| \ge L_{\mathrm{grad}}$, the average squared norm of the reward gradient along the line segment connecting them is bounded below:
2134: 
2135: $$
2136: \frac{1}{\|x-y\|} \int_{0}^{\|x-y\|} \big\|\nabla R_{\mathrm{pos}}\big(x + t\tfrac{y-x}{\|y-x\|}\big)\big\|^2 dt \ge \kappa_{\mathrm{grad}}.
2137: 
2138: $$
items.raw_directive:
2128: For the geometric ergodicity proof in `convergence.md` to hold, the Euclidean Gas must satisfy an additional environmental axiom that strengthens the Axiom of Environmental Richness. This axiom prevents pathological scenarios where positional diversity and reward signals become decoupled.
